Title: 'We walked into a wasteland' - BBC's Jeremy Bowen in Gaza with Israeli forces
paragraph: The BBC's international editor Jeremy Bowen has travelled with the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) into Gaza.,While the BBC had editorial control of the report, the section with the IDF has been viewed by them.,The IDF showed the BBC what they said was a Hamas weapons factory, below a home in which children lived.

Title: Deer soars over two cars in CCTV video
paragraph: Home CCTV captured the moment a deer flew over two cars in New Jersey, in the US, before crash-landing into the back of a pick-up its owner, Jay Vaughan, was trying to sell.,Mr Vaughan posted the footage on social media, saying the crash happened just as a potential buyer was pulling up to see the pick-up.,The buyer was apparently not put off by the deer's escapade, and bought the pick-up anyway, according to Mr Vaughan.

Title: ‘No anaesthesia, painkillers’: Giving birth in Gaza
paragraph: As Israel continues striking Gaza following the Hamas attacks on 7 October, the death toll in the enclave has reached 10,500, according to the Hamas-run health ministry, More than 4,300 children are said to have died. ,New mothers in Gaza speak of giving birth amid war and the fears they have for their children's futures.

Title: California WW2-era blimp hanger engulfed in flames
paragraph: A historic former blimp hangar has been engulfed in flames in Tustin, California.,The massive wooden structure, one of two at the former Marine Corps Air Station Tustin, had been used to house blimps during World War Two, before later becoming a set for a variety of film and TV shows.,An investigation into the cause of the fire has been launched, police said, and no injuries have been reported.,The local fire authority had said the best way to treat the fire was to allow the building to collapse.

Title: Spirit of Discovery: Huge waves filmed by cruise ship passenger
paragraph: A cruise passenger has filmed huge waves which buffeted the Spirit of Discovery ship in the Bay of Biscay.,Alan Grisedale said the swell knocked his wife over and moved furniture in their cabin.,About 100 people were injured when the boat veered dramatically during a safety manoeuvre on Saturday.,Most of the injuries were described as minor by cruise company Saga, but five people were taken to hospital when the ship docked in Portsmouth on Monday.
